abstracts.cdata!:
The revised project development
            objective is to support the implementation of the national
            development strategy by empowering poor communities and
            vulnerable population groups to manage their priority needs,
            and to contribute to employment and wage incomes in selected
            poor rural communities during the current economic
            contraction and during the recovery. The Second Moldova
            Social Investment Fund Project (MSIF II) demonstrates good
            implementation progress. After having completed the
            implementation program for the original credit MSIF has
            disbursed about 80 percent of the (first) additional
            financing credit and fully committed the part of the credit
            allocated for subprojects. Implementation of the most recent
            second additional financing credit of USD20 million has
            reached a very intense phase. The restructuring is
            undertaken to amend the provisions in the financing
            agreement for credit to allow utilization of the Government
            of Moldova (GoM) list of schools that will not be closed
            under the schools optimization program as a basis for
            investing the credit proceeds in school-related subprojects.
